news_header: A red warning is issued for Ireland and Scotland due to Storm Éowynn, indicating life-threatening conditions.
news_text: Today, a high-level red warning is in effect for Ireland and Scotland because of Storm Éowynn. The BBC reports that this rare warning indicates that airborne debris could pose a risk to life. The storm is expected to be one of the strongest in Ireland, with wind speeds potentially reaching hurricane levels, according to the Irish Independent. Forecasts predict winds could peak at around 40 meters per second.
